data.text: @InfectiousDz Was this study conducted before vaccines?
@InfectiousDz Careful, blue tick experts will say you are fear mongering 👀
Agree that a fascinating follow up would be to see if vaccines affected outcomes in breakthrough infections versus perhaps reinfection versus first infections.

@InfectiousDz Still, in #Italy no further boosting for those 65+ and older, except few solid organ transplant recipients... Total failure of children vaccination campaign, mitigation measures shelved... ... 💣
@InfectiousDz I would bet $$ that it comes back as soon as the sensory neurons relaying that information to those areas regenerate.

@InfectiousDz The loss of smell area is not too concerning to me--- lacking scent input for a month or more will cause less activation/less area for the places that process that information. Nothing to process = less resources devoted to processing it.
@InfectiousDz @V2019N how do the brain scans look for recovered vaxxed people .. and difference?
@BasilNSybil hard to say, certainly can't extrapolate the findings to kids, but would not chose COVID for any child

The study was among 785 participants (aged 51–81) imaged twice (401 COVID+ between scans and 384 stayed COVID- but also had 2 scans). Some changes occur with age, but COVID was associated with faster progression. This study did not capture younger ages
@InfectiousDz Any reason we can hope this doesn’t apply to kids? So many children infected…and not much being done to prevent further infections
